intro: Elatostema tritepalum, commonly known as the three-lobed elatostema, is a member of the Bryophyllum family. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are typically ovate or elliptical in shape. It produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Elatostema tritepalum is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
